page.title: 01 ATTLEBOROUGH
page.content: ATTLEBOROUGH(Population 6406) is situated 15 miles SW of Norwich on the A11.It provides a comprehensive range of amenities and services for those living in this flourishing farming area.Recent excavations on the A11 bypass revealed the existence of a Saxon highway which suggests that the town may date back to the Saxon or Roman period.Attleborough was a Market Town in 1285 and had a yearly fair granted in 1310. The Parish Church of St.Marys probably dates back to the Saxon period and has a well preserved screen and some medieval wall paintings worthy of mention. The town became an actual staging post for coaches and one of the earliest turnpikes is recorded on a pillar(dated 1695) just North of the town on the A11.
